cards.name: Abandoned Den
cards.text:
Abandoned Den enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life. Activate only as a sorcery and only if you control a black creature.

cards.name: Aegis Expertise
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Aegis Expertise enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3.

cards.flavor: “Ink fades. Stone erodes. Lasting wisdom is etched into flesh and carried by blood.”
cards.name: Ancient Studies
cards.text: Draw two cards. Then discard a card unless you control an embattled creature. (A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)

cards.flavor: The white wolves of Glacia looked strikingly different to those of Nangjiao, but Seto and Xiong could sense their danger all the same.
cards.name: Arctic Pack
cards.text: Create three 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens.

cards.name: Ascetic of Imbalance
cards.text:
Flash
When Ascetic of Imbalance enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then discard two cards. If you discarded two cards that don't share a type, Ascetic of Imbalance deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Concentration can open one's eyes to the world or close them from it.
cards.name: Aspect of Focus
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Tap target creature.
• Untap target creature.
• Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Saffrisa's conquest will raze this world and let Skhorvall starve in the ashes. Either she dies, or we do.”
cards.name: Astrid, Disgruntled Princess
cards.text: When Astrid, Disgruntled Princess enters the battlefield, destroy target creature with mana value less than or equal to the number of Warriors you control.

cards.name: Attuned Prodigy
cards.text:
Prowess
Other Monks you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a spell during another player's turn, untap each Monk you control.

cards.flavor: Some find enlightenment only in the weight of a weapon.
cards.name: Awoken Soul
cards.text: Target creature you control gains lifelink until end of turn. Arm it. (Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)

cards.flavor: Know how to fight, and you're useful. Know how to spur others to fight, and you're important. Know how to do both at the same time, and you're irreplaceable.
cards.name: Battle Roarer
cards.text:
Vigilance
{4}{G}{G}, {T}: Other creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bear Necessities
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Bear Necessities: Enchanted creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Leave behind your human life and learn the ways of Bjarndyr, and you might one day be as good as our weakest.”
—Rilid, Bjarndyr hearthwarden
cards.name: Bear in Mind
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 8/8.

cards.flavor: Prince Asjarni was more frightening in death than he ever was in life.
cards.name: Bearhide Cloak
cards.text:
Equipped creature has menace and trample.
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: A Skhorvall viking is only considered of age after they complete their First Revenge: the murder of an outsider and the theft of all they have, and proof of the strength to strike against a world the clan believes to scorn them.
cards.name: Bearhide Initiate
Beat Down
cards.text: Target creature you control gains indestructible until end of turn if it's embattled. Then it fights target creature you don't control. (A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)

cards.flavor: The giant's deep shout knocked Xiong flat on his back long before its club had the chance.
cards.name: Bellowing Giant
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.flavor:
“Burn the ships Saffrisa made the dead steer. They can only return to their hard-earned rest in ashes as long as that scythe's in her hands.”
—Astrid, leader of the Skhorvall dissenters
cards.name: Bereave
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland permanent card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor: What one member of the pack learns, the rest of the pack soon knows.
cards.name: Bestial Harmony

rulings.text: The sacrifice isn't optional. If the ability triggers multiple times at once, you will only draw the cards during the resolution of the ability that causes you to sacrifice it.

cards.text: When a creature you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, sacrifice Bestial Harmony. If you do, draw three cards.

cards.flavor: “Here's my advice to you, cub: the space between life and death is as broad or narrow as your weapon's reach.”
cards.name: Bjarndyr Bruiser
cards.text: Bjarndyr Bruiser gets +2/+2 as long as it's embattled. (A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)

cards.flavor: “From the rest of my brethren, I learned how to take life. From the Culi-Sae, I learned how to spare it.”
cards.name: Bjarndyr Mender
cards.text: When Bjarndyr Mender enters the battlefield, other creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “My every deed is devoted to reminding this world of our valor.”
cards.name: Bjarndyr Militant
cards.text: When Bjarndyr Militant enters the battlefield, return target Aura card or card with fabled from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Bjarndyr Outfitter
cards.text: When Bjarndyr Outfitter enters the battlefield, arm up to two target creatures you control. (Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)

cards.flavor: “The choice is upon us! Live in shame, or die in glory!”
cards.name: Bjarndyr Sergeant
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever Bjarndyr Sergeant attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Many in Glacia look up to the Bjarndyr as examples of respect and glory. The Bjarndyr look up to him.
cards.name: Bjarndyr Venerable
cards.text:
Trample
Other Bears you control get +2/+2.

cards.flavor: It remembers every man it has tasted, and forever thirsts for more.
cards.name: Blood Hunter's Spear
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, choose target creature defending player controls. Destroy that creature at end of combat.
Equip {4}

cards.name: Bloodguard's Hand
Bloodhunter Orca
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Bloodhunter Orca enters the battlefield, target opponent sacrifices a creature that was dealt damage this turn.

cards.flavor: “A river of blood for every drop of Skhorvall spilled!”
cards.name: Bloodshed Devotee
cards.text:
Other Warriors you control get +2/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control dies, Bloodshed Devotee deals 1 damage to target opponent.

cards.flavor: He wears a cape stained red with the blood of his enemies to challenge his brethren into shedding even more.
cards.name: Bloodsworn Provoker
cards.text: {T}: Another target Warrior you control gets +1/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Shed your steel and your spells. Breathe in, find from inside you the strength nature gave you, and let it bloom for all the world to see.”
cards.name: Blossoming Defense
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains hexproof until end of turn.

cards.name: Blow Away

rulings.text: If there are no creatures on the battlefield, neither player has dominance.

cards.text:
Dominance — If you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power, you may pay {U} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Brain Feeding
cards.text:
Target player discards two cards.
Fabled {3}{B}{B} (Then if you cast this for its fabled cost, put it onto the battlefield transformed attached to that player.)

cards.flavor:
“With each new second of his unlife, another memory seeped away from his mind and past his desperate grasp.”
—Hemley Eggfeather
cards.name: Mind Bleeding
cards.text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player's maximum hand size is reduced by two.

cards.flavor:
“Leave him in the snow. Anyone too weak of heart to face our future deserves no part in it.”
—Saffrisa, Heir Apparent
cards.name: Breathless Gasp
cards.text: Exile target creature. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: The abundance of predators in Glacia has forced smaller ones to evolve additional weapons.
cards.name: Bristled Wolverine
cards.text: Whenever Bristled Wolverine attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Do you think about the hive of each bug you swat, little one? No? Then don't ask me to care about your petty smallfolk battle lines, either.”
cards.name: Byway Bruiser
cards.text: Whenever Byway Bruiser enters or leaves the battlefield, you may have it deal 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Sages have written entire books on the nature of power, but its true meaning is a single word: “No.”
cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Cane Dancer
cards.text:
Flash
When Cane Dancer enters the battlefield, you may cast target blue instant or sorcery card with mana value 2 from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.

cards.name: Casualty of War
cards.text:
Casualty of War deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
{2}{R}{R}, Exile Casualty of War from your graveyard: Arm up to two target creatures you control. Activate only as a sorcery. (Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)

cards.flavor: “One is all, and all is one. Know this, and you will never be alone.”
cards.name: Centered Acolyte
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, if it isn't your main phase, create a 1/1 white Monk creature token, then creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“With nowhere else to go, the prisoner moves inward and discovers the truth of life.”
—Gurifu, Rakkiri chainwarden
cards.name: Chains of Subdual

rulings.text: This stops death triggers.

cards.text:
Creatures entering or leaving the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger. (This includes dying.)
Players can't sacrifice creatures to cast spells or activate abilities.

cards.flavor: “Believe yourself worthy of blessing, and it will come.”
cards.name: Charmed Sage
cards.text: Whenever Charmed Sage deals combat damage to a player, draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
“Why spend all that pitch and preparation time when you can just cut out the middle man?”
—Tuli-Nen, Culi-Sae flamebender
cards.name: Cinder Arrows
cards.text: Cinder Arrows deals 3 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Cogent Recruiter
cards.text: Dominance — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power, you may pay {R}. If you do, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Empty yourself of doubt, and strength will fill the missing space.”
cards.name: Conviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: As Skara Grove lay in splinters around the defeated Rakkiri, they learned not to try to ambush a giant in a forest.
cards.name: Copse Crusher
cards.text: Whenever Copse Crusher becomes blocked by one or more creatures, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Crash of Hooves

rulings.text: If there are no creatures on the battlefield, neither player has dominance.

cards.text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Dominance — You may reveal a creature card from among them instead if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

cards.name: Crippling Apparition
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an embattled creature you control attacks, tap target creature defending player controls. (A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)

cards.flavor: Their world bereft of recourse from the undead, the Culi-Sae reached out beyond it.
cards.name: Cryptic Ritual
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Target opponent may have you put those cards into your hand. Otherwise, put those cards into your graveyard, then draw three cards.

cards.text:
Double strike
{3}{W}: Arm target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery. (Create a colorless Equipment artifact token with “Equipped creature gets +1/+0” and equip {2}, then attach it to that creature.)

cards.flavor: “Unearned glory is fragile as snow. I will be your sunrise.”
cards.name: Culi-Sae Mesmer

Flash
When Culi-Sae Mesmer enters the battlefield, return all permanents attached to target permanent or player to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Culi-Sae Partisan
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, target embattled creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains vigilance and indestructible until end of turn. (A creature is embattled if it has a counter on it or has a permanent you control attached to it.)

cards.name: Culi-Sae Transfigurer
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Culi-Sae Transfigurer enters the battlefield, switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “Tales and treasures call to me, begging for appreciation only I can give.”
cards.name: Curio Connoisseur
cards.text:
First strike
Aura spells and spells with fabled you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Equip costs you pay cost {1} less.

cards.flavor: It craves to understand life, oblivious to the cost of its curiosity.
cards.name: Dark Harvester
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As Saffrisa's raids went on, Astrid began to realize they were causing more destruction than gain.
cards.name: Dawn Siege
cards.text: Dawn Siege deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to each other creature.

cards.flavor: Those who have never known life grasp it the hardest.

Flying

cards.flavor:
“Victory by overwhelming victory, hate gave way to fear, fear to awe, and awe to fealty.”
—Hemley Eggfeather
cards.name: Command Respect
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature must be blocked if able.

cards.flavor: The citadel had taken years of work from human, bear, and fox alike to complete. It was a stalwart testament to the Rakkiri's ideals of peace and coexistence—but in the end, it burned like so much firewood.
cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Departed Evangel
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay 1 life.
Departed Evangel can't block.
You may cast Departed Evangel from your graveyard if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Devastating Blow

Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
Fabled {3}{R}{R} (Then if you cast this for its fabled cost, put it onto the battlefield transformed attached to that creature.)

cards.flavor:
“. . . his loyalty, once betrayed, would forevermore be to himself alone.”
—Hemley Eggfeather

cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Betrayer's Mantle deals 3 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: “They're not Skhorvall anymore! Kill them like you would any outsider who threatens us!”

Haste

cards.flavor: “You've amused me, little thief. Take what you will, but remember—some jokes are best told only once.”

cards.text:
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
“Anyone can have talent. I take under my wing only the rare few with true ambition.”
—Syrina, the Dragon Queen

cards.flavor: A punishment every member of the Culi-Sae order fears is the Maw of Time; every story and proof of one's success sealed away and forgotten, killing their legacy before it can ever be born.
cards.name: Efface
cards.text: Exile target enchantment or Equipment.

cards.flavor:
“Make no pacts with the ghoul that roams the western graveyard. Oh, it will do as told . . . but the mark of your covenant will forever burn in your flesh.”
—Aling-Mang, Culi-Sae mentor

cards.text: Destroy target creature. You lose 4 life.

cards.text:
Scry X, where X is target creature's power.

cards.flavor:
“Some say she still wanders the moonlit nights, seeing only what Ebilir wants her to.”
—Hemley Eggfeather

Enchant creature

Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen card type. This effect doesn't remove Equanimity. (This permanent can't be targeted, dealt damage, enchanted, or equipped by anything with that card type.)

cards.flavor:
“With the full force of the true Skhorvall behind us, we will not fall to Saffrisa's unholy horde!”
—Telam, last words
cards.name: Fateful Journey
cards.text: Search your library for a card, reveal it, then shuffle and put that card on top. You lose life equal to its mana value.

cards.flavor: The village offered to the vengeful vikings an innocent scapegoat to sate their bloodlust. She alone survived.
cards.name: Fiery Reckoning
cards.text: Target opponent chooses up to one creature. Destroy the rest.

cards.name: Flailing Terror
cards.text:
Sacrifice two other creatures: Monstrosity 2. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Flailing Terror becomes monstrous, target opponent sacrifices two creatures.

cards.flavor:
“The human must kill for fur to survive the winter, while so many other races were made with fur of our own. It is clear who Glacia favors more.”
—Scalhun, Bjarndyr militant
cards.name: Fleecy Lynx

cards.flavor: It eats the brain and wears the rest.

cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, monstrosity 1. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.flavor:
“See how the wild fox protects the crow? How the crow shares its food with the fox? Harmony, not conflict, is life's true nature.”
—Aurum, Rakkiri elder
cards.name: Forest Fellowship

rulings.text: Starting with the next opponent in turn order, each opponent may put a card onto the battlefield. If any of those players does, the process repeats, even if you don't have any more cards to play.

cards.text: You may put a creature or land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Then each opponent may put a permanent card from their hand onto the battlefield. If one does, you may repeat this process.

cards.flavor: The first of her kin that Saffrisa raised with the Bloodguard's Hand rose as things between worlds, too weak to be accepted by her tribe and too immaterial to control.
cards.name: Forgotten Experiment
cards.text: Forgotten Experiment can't be blocked.

cards.text:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls deals damage to you, monstrosity 2. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
Frigid Behemoth can't attack unless it's monstrous.

cards.flavor: Today, a scourge. Tomorrow, splinters.

—Luo Tari, Culi-Sae initiate

cards.name: Hungering Horde

Menace

cards.flavor:
“What more glorious way is there to pass from this world than to become one's own monument?”
—Luo Tari, Culi-Sae initiate
cards.name: Ice Over
cards.text:
Enchant artifact or creature
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

{4}{G}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.flavor: Deep within the frozen ground and amidst the ruins of a dead civilization, long-forgotten mechanisms still shape the climate of the world above.
cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Imperial Chimera
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 2.
Reveal the top card of your library: If a creature card with flying was revealed this way, Imperial Chimera gains flying until end of turn. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, and vigilance.

cards.name: Inborn Instincts
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Inborn Instincts enters the battlefield, enchanted creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: “This world will give us no respite. We must give it to each other.”

cards.name: Invocation Circle

cards.text: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal two instant and/or sorcery cards. Exile those cards, then that player shuffles the rest into their library. You may cast cards exiled this way until end of turn, and you may cast them without paying their mana costs.

cards.flavor: Remnants of the Hand's former wielder yet linger, masterless and thus empty of any drive but hunger.
cards.name: Issbarren Creeper
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever Issbarren Creeper deals combat damage to a player, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Issbarren Phoenix

Flying, haste
Dominance — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power, you may pay {1}{R}. If you do, return Issbarren Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: “Leave behind everything you don't need. The Issbarrens are fickle on the best of days, and extra weight won't help that.”
cards.name: Issbarren Warden
cards.text:
Flash
When Issbarren Warden enters the battlefield, exile target token.

cards.flavor:
“No one will claim your corpses. No one will guard your rest. You chose a traitor's life; now, die a traitor's death.”
—Astrid, leader of the Skhorvall dissenters

cards.text: Counter target creature spell or target spell that targets a creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: It wanders the land sharing its glow, oblivious to the fear it spreads.

Flying

cards.text:

cards.flavor: Eivrik knew he was losing his mind when he saw his dead beloved before him—she had no doubt become ghoulstuff long ago—but he only cared that his final night could be spent lying by her side.
cards.name: Last Dusk
cards.text: Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor:
“Get the rotten things with bows from now on. The witch has sent far more enemies than we thought.”
—Asmund, Bjarndyr headsman
cards.name: Leech-Ridden Corpse
cards.text: When Leech-Ridden Corpse dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Believing the terrors of the sea to be confined to it is the last mistake of many.

cards.flavor:
“The perfect prey. Flesh for meat, fur for cloaks, hide for armor, tusks for weapons. Why hunt anything else?”
—Rimnir, Skhorvall youngling

cards.flavor: A lock of its fur, when burnt, allows one to gain the respect of great and terrible predators for a day and a night.

cards.text: Dominance — When Mammoth Crab enters the battlefield, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest power or tied for the greatest power.

cards.flavor: If you think you've survived the hunt, you're likely just being saved for later.

Enchant creature

cards.flavor: What doesn't kill you makes you scarier.

cards.flavor: “You either let yourself care for the outsiders and die to their betrayal or close your ears, march on, and live. I made my choice long ago.”

cards.flavor: “The sun shows warm lies like a mother too soft to wean its child from hope. Scry in moonlight, see, suffer, and grow.”

Look at the top two cards of your library. You may shuffle.

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor:
“A pale parody though it may be, it is still born of dragon souls—and so, it is still my child.”
—Syrina, Dragon Queen
cards.name: Syrina's Brood

cards.flavor:
“The weak serve the strong, and the strong protect and inspire the weak. So it is, and so it should forever be.”
—Scalhun, Bjarndyr militant

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor: They had conquered bears, zombies, and even giants, but they met their match in mere snow and wind.

cards.flavor: The night, the blood, the pain, the fear—all together snapped their minds, and a unified front became an indiscriminate massacre.
